column4: ergh... when i try to execute qparted gives folowing error: could not execute child process qparted: no such file or directory ( i just installed it now)
i just installed it from synaptic
yes
what programs are you having problems starting?
are you using gnome or kde?
do you have a "K" menu, or do you have an "Application, Places, System" menu on your desktop
ok, you're using gnome.
have you tried running gparted?.. its the p artition editor for gnome.
Qparted and Gparted are different
i know that..
open a terminal, and type "qtparted" w/o quotes, and see if it gives you any errors.
no prob, but tis silly to run qtparted.. thats really a KDE app,b ut as long as it does what you want
swap should generally be 1.5-2x your memory
6gigs would be al ittle overkill
1.5-2x your system ram, is just a general rule.. you'll be fine w/ 1-2gigs
good luck, just make sure your stuff is backed up.. that sounds like it will be a task
you need to use a live CD most likely
you can't resize a partition you're actively using... common sense there.
google the partedmagic live CD.. its easy to use, a quick download, burn it to CD, and use it.. its great.
qtparted isn't.. but i think the live CD has gparted.. which should work
i would guess you could.. but i don't know for sure.
